title: Lesson 13
paragraph: This lesson examines society and hierarchy, exploring social classes, structures, and organization.

words.meaning: the arrangement or classification of something into layers or ranks
words.example: Social stratification often determines access to resources.

words.meaning: workers or working-class people, regarded collectively
words.japaneseMeaning: 労働者階級、プロレタリアート
words.example: The revolution aimed to empower the proletariat.

words.meaning: the middle/upper-middle class, typically with materialistic values
words.japaneseMeaning: ブルジョワ、資本家階級
words.example: The bourgeoisie often owned the means of production.

words.meaning: a class of people holding exceptional rank and privileges
words.example: The aristocracy controlled much of the land and wealth.

words.meaning: a system in which people are promoted based on ability or talent
words.example: The company claims to operate as a meritocracy.

words.meaning: a system of government or management with many rules and procedures
words.example: The bureaucracy slowed down the approval process.

words.meaning: a government controlled by a small group of people
words.example: The country was ruled by an oligarchy of wealthy merchants.

words.meaning: government or control by technical experts
words.example: Some propose a technocracy to manage complex modern problems.

words.meaning: people of high social standing or landowners
words.example: The gentry often had political influence in local communities.

words.meaning: a hereditary social group with fixed status
words.example: The society was divided into strict castes.
